verses.kjv: And there shall come forth a rod out of the stem of Jesse, and a Branch shall grow out of his roots:
verses.ct: A shoot will spring up from the stump of Jesse, and a branch will sprout from his roots.

verses.kjv: And the spirit of the LORD shall rest upon him, the spirit of wisdom and understanding, the spirit of counsel and might, the spirit of knowledge and of the fear of the LORD;
verses.ct: The spirit of the LORD will settle on him — the spirit of wisdom and understanding, the spirit of guidance and power, the spirit of knowledge and wholehearted dedication to the LORD.

verses.kjv: And shall make him of quick understanding in the fear of the LORD: and he shall not judge after the sight of his eyes, neither reprove after the hearing of his ears:
verses.ct: His delight will be in wholehearted dedication to the LORD. He won't make judgments based on what he sees with his eyes, and he won't make decisions based on what he hears with his ears.

verses.kjv: But with righteousness shall he judge the poor, and reprove with equity for the meek of the earth: and he shall smite the earth with the rod of his mouth, and with the breath of his lips shall he slay the wicked.
verses.ct: Instead, he will judge the poor with righteousness and make fair decisions for the humble of the earth. He will strike the earth with the authority of his words, and with the breath of his lips he will destroy the wicked.

verses.kjv: And righteousness shall be the girdle of his loins, and faithfulness the girdle of his reins.
verses.ct: Righteousness will be wrapped around him like a belt, and faithfulness will be secured around his waist.

verses.kjv: The wolf also shall dwell with the lamb, and the leopard shall lie down with the kid; and the calf and the young lion and the fatling together; and a little child shall lead them.
verses.ct: The wolf will live alongside the lamb, and the leopard will rest beside the young goat. The calf, the young lion, and the fattened animal will be together, and a small child will guide them.

verses.kjv: And the cow and the bear shall feed; their young ones shall lie down together: and the lion shall eat straw like the ox.
verses.ct: The cow and the bear will graze side by side, and their young will lie down together. The lion will eat straw just like the ox.

verses.kjv: And the sucking child shall play on the hole of the asp, and the weaned child shall put his hand on the cockatrice’ den.
verses.ct: A nursing baby will play safely near a cobra's hole, and a toddler will reach into a viper's nest.

verses.kjv: They shall not hurt nor destroy in all my holy mountain: for the earth shall be full of the knowledge of the LORD, as the waters cover the sea.
verses.ct: Nothing will cause harm or destruction anywhere on my holy mountain, because the earth will be filled with the knowledge of the LORD, just as water fills the ocean.

verses.kjv: And in that day there shall be a root of Jesse, which shall stand for an ensign of the people; to it shall the Gentiles seek: and his rest shall be glorious.
verses.ct: On that day, the descendant of Jesse will stand as a banner for the nations. The peoples of the world will seek him out, and his dwelling place will be glorious.

verses.kjv: And it shall come to pass in that day, that the Lord shall set his hand again the second time to recover the remnant of his people, which shall be left, from Assyria, and from Egypt, and from Pathros, and from Cush, and from Elam, and from Shinar, and from Hamath, and from the islands of the sea.
verses.ct: On that day, the Lord will reach out his hand a 2nd time to reclaim the surviving remnant of his people — those remaining in Assyria, Egypt, Pathros, Cush, Elam, Shinar, Hamath, and the coastlands across the sea.

verses.kjv: And he shall set up an ensign for the nations, and shall assemble the outcasts of Israel, and gather together the dispersed of Judah from the four corners of the earth.
verses.ct: He will raise a banner for the nations and gather the exiles of Israel. He will bring together the scattered people of Judah from the 4 corners of the earth.

verses.kjv: The envy also of Ephraim shall depart, and the adversaries of Judah shall be cut off: Ephraim shall not envy Judah, and Judah shall not vex Ephraim.
verses.ct: Ephraim's jealousy will disappear, and those who are hostile toward Judah will be eliminated. Ephraim will no longer be jealous of Judah, and Judah will no longer antagonize Ephraim.

verses.kjv: But they shall fly upon the shoulders of the Philistines toward the west; they shall spoil them of the east together: they shall lay their hand upon Edom and Moab; and the children of Ammon shall obey them.
verses.ct: Together they will swoop down on the Philistine hills to the west. They will plunder the peoples to the east. They will seize Edom and Moab, and the people of Ammon will submit to them.

verses.kjv: And the LORD shall utterly destroy the tongue of the Egyptian sea; and with his mighty wind shall he shake his hand over the river, and shall smite it in the seven streams, and make men go over dryshod.
verses.ct: The LORD will completely dry up the gulf of the Egyptian sea. He will sweep his hand over the Euphrates River with a scorching wind, splitting it into 7 channels so that people can walk across in their sandals.

verses.kjv: And there shall be an highway for the remnant of his people, which shall be left, from Assyria; like as it was to Israel in the day that he came up out of the land of Egypt.
verses.ct: There will be a highway for the remnant of his people who survive in Assyria, just as there was for Israel on the day they came up out of Egypt.
